about.title: About Coca-Cola Font
about.description1: Coca-Cola is a carbonated beverage made by the Coca-Cola company based in Atlanta, Georgia. The brand name originates from its two key ingredients: cocaine and caffeine, which are extracted respectively from the coca leaf and the kola nut, hence its name Coca-Cola. The Coca-Cola logo was created by Frank Mason Robinson in 1885 and the lettering style used for the logo is known as Spencerian script, which flourished from 1850 to 1925 in the United States.
about.description2: The lettering of the logotype is very similar to a font named Coca Cola II and you can download the font for free here. Loki Cola by Utopia is another similar font and it has more swash options. Alternatively, you can use our text generator below to quickly generate logos or images in the Coca-Cola style. After creating your design, you can right-click on the image to save it or click on the EMBED button to get links to embed images on the web.

q1.question: What font is used in the Coca-Cola logo?
q1.answer: The Coca-Cola logo uses Spencerian script, a distinctive handwriting style popular from 1850-1925. The Coca-Cola II font (also known as Coca Cola ii) closely replicates this iconic lettering style. Our generator uses this authentic font to help you create text graphics that match the classic Coca-Cola logo appearance.

q5.question: What is Spencerian script and how does it relate to Coca-Cola?
q5.answer: Spencerian script is an elegant American handwriting style from the 1850s-1920s. Frank Mason Robinson used this style when creating the Coca-Cola logo in 1885. The Coca-Cola II font replicates this Spencerian script style, allowing you to create text with the same flowing, elegant appearance as the iconic Coca-Cola logo.

q8.question: What colors should I use for Coca-Cola-style text?
q8.answer: Classic Coca-Cola colors are red (#F40009) and white. The original logo features white script on a red background. You can also use red text on white, black, or transparent backgrounds.
